title: Corporate Governance Practices of Soleno Therapeutics Inc

content.text: Soleno Therapeutics Inc has a board of directors consisting of highly experienced individuals from diverse backgrounds, including medical professionals, pharmaceutical executives, and experts in finance and governance. The board is composed of both independent directors and executives of the company.
Soleno Therapeutics Inc ensures a majority of independent directors on its board. This practice enhances the objectivity and accountability of decision-making within the company.

The board of Soleno Therapeutics Inc has established various committees to oversee specific areas of corporate governance. These committees include an audit committee, compensation committee, and nominating and corporate governance committee. Each committee is comprised of independent directors and is responsible for providing oversight and making recommendations in their respective areas.

Soleno Therapeutics Inc follows a transparent and performance-based approach to executive compensation. The compensation committee, which comprises independent directors, determines the compensation packages for executives. These packages are typically aligned with the company's financial performance, shareholder returns, and individual performance objectives.

Soleno Therapeutics Inc utilizes equity incentives, such as stock options and restricted stock units, to align the interests of executives with those of the shareholders. These incentives ensure that executives have a vested interest in the long-term success and value creation of the company.

Soleno Therapeutics Inc has implemented share ownership guidelines for executives, requiring them to hold a certain number of shares of the company's stock. This practice promotes a stronger alignment between executive decision-making and shareholder interests.

Soleno Therapeutics Inc conducts regular evaluations of its board of directors to assess their performance, independence, and effectiveness. These evaluations help identify areas for improvement and ensure the board remains dynamic and responsive to the company's strategic objectives.

The board of Soleno Therapeutics Inc actively oversees the company's risk management processes. It assesses and monitors risks related to operations, finance, compliance, and strategic decisions. This approach helps safeguard the interests of shareholders and ensures the company's long-term sustainability.

news.headline: Why Shares of Soleno Therapeutics Dropped on Wednesday
news.summary: Shares of Soleno Therapeutics (NASDAQ: SLNO) were down more than 23% as of 3 p.m. on Wednesday, a day after the pharmaceutical stock rose as much as 420% on news regarding its prospective treatment for Prader-Willi Syndrome (PWS), a rare genetic disorder.  Thanks to the rise, even with Soleno's shares falling on Wednesday, sellers were bound to make money, assuming they bought the stock as late as Monday when it was as high as only $4.86 a share.  On Tuesday, the clinical-stage biotech said that it planned to submit a New Drug Application (NDA) to the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) regarding diazoxide choline controlled-release (DCCR) to treat PWS.

news.headline: Soleno Therapeutics Stock Dives After Its Meteoric Rise on Positive Study Results
news.summary: Soleno Therapeutics  stock fell sharply Wednesday, reversing a small portion of its meteoric gains from the previous session.  The biotechnology company’s shares had skyrocketed 505% on Tuesday to $26.80, marking the stock’s largest percentage increase on record and its highest close since March 2021, according to Dow Jones Market Data.  Prader-Willi Syndrome affects metabolism, and its hallmark symptom is hyperphagia—a chronic feeling of intense, persistent hunger and an intense drive to consume food.

news.headline: Why Shares of Soleno Therapeutics Are Booming on Tuesday
news.summary: Shares of Soleno Therapeutics (NASDAQ: SLNO) were up more than 372% as of 12:30 p.m. on Tuesday.  On Tuesday, before the markets opened, it announced that its lead pipeline candidate, diazoxide choline controlled-release (DCCR), an extended-release pill to treat Prader-Willi syndrome (PWS), showed a dramatic improvement in hyperphagia-related behaviors compared to a placebo.  The company said it plans to submit a New Drug Application (NDA) to the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for DCCR to treat PWS.

news.headline: Wall St slides as rate concerns keep Treasury yields near 16-year peak
news.summary: Wall Street's main indexes dived on Tuesday as 10-year Treasury yields held their multi-year highs, with investors continuing to grapple with the prospects of a prolonged restrictive monetary policy and its subsequent economic impact.
